grammar-rules: Code blocks must be wrapped between opening_tag '{' and closing_tag '}'
Elements must be one of the defined tags in tokens
Elements can be separated by commas
Container elements (row, box) can contain other elements
Leaf elements (input, select-box, title, text, button) cannot contain other elements
Attributes are specified in angle brackets after the tag: tag_name <attribute=value>
Color attributes must be in RGB format: <color=(r,g,b)> where r,g,b are between 0-255
Multiple attributes can be specified using commas: <attr1=value1,attr2=value2>
Empty DSL input is not allowed
Each opening tag must have a matching closing tag
Select-box elements automatically generate options in the HTML output
Input elements automatically generate placeholder text
Each element can have both predefined CSS classes and dynamic CSS attributes
Invalid or unknown tokens will raise validation errors

tokens.{: opening tag that should be in the beginning of the code and after any token row,box
tokens.}: closing tag should be in the end of the code and match opening tags
tokens.,: separator between elements at the same level
tokens.<>: attribute wrapper that contains element properties
tokens.row: container element that represents horizontal layout, can contain multiple boxes
tokens.box: container element that represents vertical layout, can contain multiple unit elements
tokens.button: leaf element that represents a clickable button
tokens.title: leaf element that represents a heading text
tokens.text: leaf element that represents regular text content
tokens.select-box: leaf element that represents a dropdown selection menu
tokens.input: leaf element that represents a text input field
